Pre-Game Insights: England have dominated Greece, remaining undefeated in nine previous encounters, winning seven and drawing two.
Greece edges out England on goal difference, setting up a tantalising battle.
The Three Lions are hungry to extend that unbeaten streak and push for an immediate return to Nations League A.
England are determined to make this match a statement of intent.
Greece will look to challenge England with a disciplined defensive approach.
It’s difficult to envision anything other than a convincing win for England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Captain Harry Kane is set to lead the line after overcoming an injury scare while on duty with Bayern Munich.
In a surprise recall, Dominic Solanke has been called up for the first time in seven years, while Phil Foden, Jude Bellingham, and Kyle Walker are expected to feature.
West Ham’s Dinos Mavropanos and Liverpool’s Kostas Tsimikas likely to start for Greece.
The game will be broadcast live in the UK on ITV1, with live streaming available via the ITVX app.
The match will take place at Wembley Stadium, London on Thursday, 10 October 2024, kick-off 7:45 pm BST.
Others: England will face Greece in a highly anticipated Nations League encounter at Wembley this Thursday, marking their first meeting in 18 years.
The most memorable match between these nations dates back 23 years to David Beckham’s iconic last-minute free kick that sealed England’s spot in the 2002 World Cup.
